verses.text: 「贖愆祭的律例是這樣：這祭是至聖的。

words.note: Lit. 'sacrifice for fault/transgression'.
Often used for things dedicated to God, like the Most Holy Place.

verses.text: 人在甚麼地方宰殺燔祭牲，就要在那裡宰殺贖愆祭牲，牠的血要潑在祭壇的四周。

words.note: '燔祭' is burnt offering, '牲' specifies animal.
'贖愆祭' is guilt offering, '牲' specifies animal.

verses.text: 祭司要把祭牲的一切脂肪都獻上，就是肥尾巴和遮蓋內臟的脂肪，

words.note: Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Refers to the fatty tail of certain sheep breeds, significant in Levitical law.

verses.text: 以及兩個腎、腎上近腰旁的脂肪和腎旁的肝葉，一起取下。

words.note: Refers to the fat covering the kidneys, or the adrenal glands.
Often refers to the fat near the kidneys, or the 'caul' of the liver attached to kidneys.

verses.text: 然後把這些焚燒在祭壇上，作獻給耶和華的火祭，這是贖愆祭。

words.note: Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Used here as a locative suffix indicating position 'on the altar'.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
An offering made by fire, as commanded in the Law.
Lit. 'sacrifice for fault/transgression'.

verses.text: 祭司家中的男丁，都可以吃祭牲的肉，要在聖潔的地方吃；這是至聖的。

words.note: One who manages sacrifices.
Refers to adult males in a household/clan.

verses.text: 贖罪祭怎樣，贖愆祭也怎樣；兩個祭的律例相同；

words.note: An offering for atonement of sin.
An offering for unintentional offenses or trespasses.

verses.text: 祭物要歸主持贖罪的祭司，祭司替人獻燔祭，祭牲的皮要歸獻燔祭的祭司。

words.note: An offering completely consumed by fire.

verses.heading: Priestly Portions of Burnt and Grain Offerings

verses.text: 一切在爐裡烤的，或在淺鍋裡或在煎盤上做的素祭，都要歸給那獻祭的祭司。

words.note: An offering of flour or grain, not meat.

verses.text: 一切用油調和，或是乾的素祭，都要歸給亞倫所有的子孫，大家均分。
「獻給耶和華的平安祭的律例是這樣：
verses.heading: The Peace Offering

verses.text: 人若是為感恩獻祭，就要用調油的無酵餅和抹了油的無酵薄餅，以及用油調和了細麵做的餅，與感恩祭一同獻上。

words.note: Often used in religious context for 'thanksgiving'.
A type of peace offering made for thanks.

verses.text: 他要把他的供物，連同有酵的餅，跟那為感恩而獻的平安祭，一起獻上。

words.note: Marks the object before the verb.
Connects verb phrases, indicating cause or purpose.

verses.text: 他要從各物中，取出一個餅作為舉祭，獻給耶和華，歸給那潑平安祭牲之血的祭司。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.
A portion of an offering dedicated to God by being lifted up.
Classical Chinese possessive particle, similar to 'de'.

verses.text: 「為感恩而獻的平安祭的肉，只能在獻祭那日吃，一點也不可留到早晨。

words.note: More formal/biblical; everyday usage is 那天 (nàtiān).
Used with negation (不可) to mean 'not at all'.

verses.text: 他獻的供物若是還願祭，或是甘心祭，獻祭那日可以吃；剩下的，第二天也可以吃。

words.note: Lit. 'sweet heart sacrifice', meaning from a willing heart.

verses.text: 還剩下的祭肉，到了第三天，就要用火燒掉。
如果在第三天吃平安祭的肉，必不蒙悅納，他獻上的也不再算為祭，因為祭肉已經成為不潔；吃這肉的人，必擔當自己的罪責。

words.note: A set phrase meaning to be graciously received or accepted.

verses.text: 「祭肉若是接觸了任何不潔，就不可以吃，要用火燒掉。潔淨的人才可以吃祭肉；
身上不潔淨的人吃了獻與耶和華的平安祭的祭肉，那人必從自己的族人中被剪除。
人若是摸了任何不潔，或是人的污穢，或是牲畜的污穢，或是任何不潔淨的可憎之物，然後吃獻給耶和華的平安祭的肉，那人必從自己的族人中被剪除。」

words.note: Lit. 'a thing that can be hated'.
Functions as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 耶和華對摩西說：
verses.heading: Sacrificial Instructions for the Common People: Fat and Blood

verses.text: 「你要告訴以色列人說：所有公牛、綿羊或是山羊的脂肪，你們都不可吃。
自死的或被野獸撕裂的動物的脂肪，可以作別的用途，只是你們決不可吃。

words.note: Refers to an animal that died of natural causes.

words.definition: to make, to be used as

verses.text: 因為無論何人吃了獻給耶和華為火祭的牲畜的脂肪，那吃的人就必從自己的族人中被剪除。

words.note: Functions as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 在你們的一切住處，任何血，無論是飛鳥或是牲畜的，你們都不可吃。

words.note: Indicates choice or condition without distinction.
Here forming a nominal phrase: 'that of livestock'.
Strong prohibition.

verses.text: 無論誰吃了甚麼血，那人必從自己的族人中被剪除。」

words.note: Refers to being excommunicated or cut off from the community.

verses.text: 耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, rendered 'LORD' in English Bibles.

verses.heading: Priestly Portions of Peace Offerings

verses.text: 「你要告訴以色列人：向耶和華獻平安祭的，必須從他的平安祭中取出奉給耶和華的供物。

words.note: People of Israel; Yǐsèliè is a transliteration.
A type of sacrifice for peace and fellowship with God.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'those who offer peace offerings'.
A verb-complement construction meaning 'to take out'.
To respectfully give or present to someone.

verses.text: 親手把獻給耶和華的火祭帶來，就是把脂肪連胸帶來，在耶和華面前搖一搖，作為搖祭。

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.
An offering made by fire, often involving burning on an altar.
A verb-complement construction meaning 'to bring (here)'.

breakdown.m: one (numerical classifier, here indicates brief action)

words.note: Reduplication with 一 often denotes a brief or light action.
A specific type of offering presented by waving before the altar.

verses.text: 祭司要把脂肪焚燒在祭壇上，胸歸給亞倫和他的子孫。

words.note: Here refers to sacrificial fat.
Here refers to the sacrificial breast.

verses.text: 你們要從平安祭牲中，拿右後腿來作舉祭，奉給祭司。

words.note: Formal verb for offering respectfully.

verses.text: 亞倫的子孫中，誰獻平安祭牲的血和脂肪，右後腿就歸給他，是他的分。

words.note: Often symbolic in biblical contexts.
Here refers to sacrificial fat.
Refers to a allocated share or portion.

verses.text: 因為我從以色列人的平安祭中，取出了這搖祭的胸和舉祭的後腿，給亞倫祭司和他的子孫，成為以色列人中永遠的律例。

words.note: Here refers to the sacrificial breast.

verses.text: 「這是亞倫和他子孫，從奉獻他們作耶和華的祭司那日開始，受膏立應得的分。

words.note: Lit. 'receive anointing and establishment'.
Refers to a allocated share or portion.

verses.text: 就是耶和華膏立他們的時候，命令以色列人給他們的。這是世世代代永遠的律例。」

words.note: A reduplicative phrase emphasizing continuation through generations.

verses.text: 以上關於燔祭、素祭、贖罪祭、贖愆祭、承受聖職祭和平安祭的律例，

words.note: Refers to the offering made for the consecration of priests.

verses.heading: Summary of Sacrificial Regulations in Leviticus 6:8-7:36

verses.text: 都是耶和華在西奈山吩咐摩西的，就是他在西奈的曠野吩咐以色列人，把他們的供物獻給耶和華的時候所說的。

words.note: Precedes direct object, indicating disposition.
`所` nominalizes the following verb, meaning 'that which is V-ed'.
Here `的` also nominalizes the preceding phrase, meaning 'the one/thing that was said'.
